pr_title: Migrate the pxf-jdbc project to spring boot

timeline.message:
Migrate the pxf-jdbc project to spring boot

- Update top level settings.gradle to include pxf-jdbc
- Add new build.gradle for pxf-jdbc
- all existing unit tests should be ported to junit 5
- jdbc profiles should be functional

Migrate the pxf-jdbc project to spring boot

- Update top level settings.gradle to include pxf-jdbc
- Add new build.gradle for pxf-jdbc
- all existing unit tests should be ported to junit 5
- jdbc profiles should be functional
Fix unit tests after bootifying the project

timeline.bodyText: how are we able to get rid of mockito?
timeline.author: oliverralbertini

replies.bodyText: we no longer need the mockConfigurationFactory, because the configuration creation happens at the rest entrypoint
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyText: was there a whitespace change in this file?
timeline.author: oliverralbertini

timeline.bodyText: here and elsewhere, instead of passing configuration around we can have it available from the RequestContext
timeline.author: denalex
denalex

timeline.bodyText: can this be autowired rather than directly obtained from the appContext ?
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: yes, not sure why I didn't do this in the first place :)
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.author: denalex

timeline.bodyText: wonder whether making a Bridge also a Plugin is a good idea, plugins were for F/A/R classes.
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: Bridge connects both A/R, and it already had a isThreadSafe method which is also present in the Plugin.  The bridge also consumes the RequestContext and Configuration that needs to be initialized
replies.author: frankgh

timeline.bodyText: maybe parsing the request and creating configuration should go into a protected method on a BaseResource, they are repeating throughout.
timeline.author: denalex
